text: Thomas Stanley Holland (born 1 June 1996) is an English actor and dancer. He is best known for playing Spider-Man in the Marvel Cinematic Universe movies, Captain America: Civil War (2016), Spider-Man: Homecoming (2017), Avengers: Infinity War (2018), Avengers: Endgame (2019), and Spider-Man: Far From Home (2019). He also starred in the famous musical Billie Elliot (2008), Cherry (2020), Chaos Walking (2020) and Spider-Man: No Way Home (2021). He was cast to play the character Nathan Drake in the movie Uncharted (2022), based on the video game series of the same name. == Early life == Tom Holland was born at Kingston Hospital in Kingston upon Thames, He is son of Dominic Holland and Niki Holland, His mother is photographer and his father may be Comedian and Author, He has three younger brothers: Harry, Sam, and Patrick (Paddy). He was bullied in school for being a dancer. He studied Nifty Feet Dance School on his childhood, He is started to dance from his school group at the 2006 Richmond Dance Festival, where he was spotted by choreographer Lynne Page, an associate to Peter Darling, choreographer of Billy Elliot and Billy Elliot the Musical. And than studies at Donhead Preparatory School in Wimbledon, London and Wimbledon College, BRIT School and Carpentry school in Cardiff. == Personal life == Holland lives in southwest London. As of 2021, he is dating Marvel co-star Zendaya. Holland was diagnosed with dyslexia in 2003. ==References== ==Other websites== * Tom Holland at Curtis Brown Literary and Talent Agency * * * The Brothers Trust * Works by or about Tom Holland in libraries (WorldCat catalogue) Category:BAFTA Award winning actors Category:Saturn Award winners Category:1997 births Category:Living people Category:English movie actors Category:English stage actors Category:English voice actors Category:English child actors Category:English dancers Category:Actors from London Category:People with dyslexia
title: Tom Holland
